info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hamilton, Fulton and northwestern Saratoga Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Caroga Lake, or 11 miles northwest of Johnstown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Ephratah, Broadalbin, Edinburg, Northville, Mayfield, Galway, Cranberry Creek, Day Center, Northampton Beach Public Campground, Caroga Lake, Rock City Falls, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Mount Pleasant, Perth, Berkshire, Bleecker, Hope and Arietta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
